alert.note: Alert for Benton; Carroll; Henry; Weakley (Tennessee) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Memphis (Western Tennessee, Eastern Arkansas and Northern Mississippi)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 17 at 9:14AM CDT by NWS Memphis
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of Weakley, northern Benton, northeastern Obion, northern Carroll and Henry Counties through 945 AM CDT... At 914 AM CDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 8 miles northeast of Paris Landing State Park to Martin. Movement was southeast at 35 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts up to 50 mph. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Locations impacted include... Martin, Paris, McKenzie, Camden, Fulton, Paris Landing State Park, Dresden, Greenfield, Gleason, Sharon, Cottage Grove, Latham, Vale, Springville, Routon, Palmersville, Puryear, Big Sandy, Henry and Jones Mill. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...50 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. A Severe Thunderstorm Watch remains in effect until 200 PM CDT for west Tennessee.
